Configuration
C API

Configuration options, at both compile-time and run-time can be set to achieve optimal database performance. More...

 IPC client/server component.

 Journal rotation and archiving.

 Btree component traversal.
 
#define DB_TRACE_STREAM   0x00080000u
 Stream processing.

 max possible trace facility

 all facilities included

 Configure trace output for a quality assurance library. More...
 

Detailed Description

Configuration options, at both compile-time and run-time can be set to achieve optimal database performance.

Function Documentation

◆ db_set_config()

db_result_t db_set_config ( const db_config_t *  config)

Set the library configuration.

Parameters
configLibrary configuration information.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Configuration parameter is null.
See also
db_get_config, lm_set_config, lm_get_config, lm_use_local,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

This call is not supported in C/S mode and will return DB_FAIL with the error code DB_ENOTIMPL. In C/S configuration, these parameters can be set when the server is run. See documentation for dbserver in the User's Guide for more details.

◆ db_get_config()

db_result_t db_get_config ( db_config_t *  config)

Obtain library configuration.

Parameters
configReturned library configuration information.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Configuration parameter is null.
See also
db_set_config, lm_set_config, lm_get_config, lm_use_local,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

This call is not supported in C/S mode and will return DB_FAIL with the error code DB_ENOTIMPL. In C/S configuration, these parameters can be set when the server is run. See documentation for dbserver in the User's Guide for more details.

◆ lm_use_local()

db_result_t lm_use_local ( const lm_local_config_t *  config)

Use local lock manager and set configuration.

Parameters
configLocal lock manager configuration.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Configuration parameter is null.
See also
db_set_config, db_get_config, lm_set_config, lm_get_config,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

lm_set_config, lm_use_local, lm_get_config are not supported under single-user and C/S configurations and will return DB_FAIL with the error code DB_ENOTIMPL. In C/S configuration, these parameters can be set when the server is run. See documentation for dbserver in the User's Guide for more details.

◆ lm_set_config()

db_result_t lm_set_config ( const lm_config_t *  config)

Set lock manager configuration.

Parameters
configLock manager configuration.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Configuration parameter is null.
See also
db_set_config, db_get_config, lm_get_config, lm_use_local,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

lm_set_config, lm_use_local, lm_get_config are not supported under single-user and C/S configurations and will return DB_FAIL with the error code DB_ENOTIMPL. In C/S configuration, these parameters can be set when the server is run. See documentation for dbserver in the User's Guide for more details.

◆ lm_get_config()

db_result_t lm_get_config ( lm_config_t *  config)

Get current lock manager configuration.

Parameters
configReturned lock manager configuration settings.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Configuration parameter is null.
See also
db_set_config, db_get_config, lm_set_config, lm_use_local,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

lm_set_config, lm_use_local, lm_get_config are not supported under single-user and C/S configurations and will return DB_FAIL with the error code DB_ENOTIMPL. In C/S configuration, these parameters can be set when the server is run. See documentation for dbserver in the User's Guide for more details.

◆ db_config_init()

db_result_t db_config_init ( db_config_t *  config)

Initialize a database library configuration.

Parameters
configDatabase library configuration.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.
  • DB_FAIL on failure.

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

  • DB_EINVAL Storage configuration is null.
See also
db_config_destroy,
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

◆ db_info()

uintptr_t db_info ( db_t  hdb,
int  info_tag 
)

Obtain information about the library package features, including version number.

Parameters
hdbDatabase handle. The stand-alone package does not require this parameter. The client/server package uses this parameter to query a remote server for information.
info_tagSelect one of the following types of information to get:
  • DB_INFO_APIVER (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_MINAPI (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_MAJOR (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_MINOR (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_PATCH (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_BUILD (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_FULL_ANSI_NAME (returns pointer to char string)
  • DB_INFO_FULL_UTF8_NAME (returns pointer to db_utf8_t string)
  • DB_INFO_FULL_UTF16_NAME (returns pointer to db_utf16_t string)
  • DB_INFO_FULL_UTF32_NAME (returns pointer to db_utf32_t string)
  • DB_INFO_SHORT_ANSI_NAME (returns pointer to char string)
  • DB_INFO_SHORT_UTF8_NAME (returns pointer to db_utf8_t string)
  • DB_INFO_SHORT_UTF16_NAME (returns pointer to db_utf16_t string)
  • DB_INFO_SHORT_UTF32_NAME (returns pointer to db_utf32_t string)
  • DB_INFO_DEBUG (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_THREAD (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_DISPOSITION (returns integer)
  • DB_INFO_SUPPORT (returns integer)
Returns
  • Pointer to the result of the request.
  • DB_INFO_ERROR Invalid hdb or info_tag parameter.
See also
get_db_error, clear_db_error, Error Handling

◆ db_set_trace()

void db_set_trace ( const char *  trace_file,
uint32_t  enable_mask,
uint32_t  disable_mask 
)

Configure trace output for a quality assurance library.

This function has no effect if the application is not linked with an ITTIA DB quality assurance library (with suffix "_qa").

Parameters
trace_fileOutput file name. If the file exists, it is overwritten.
enable_maskList of trace logging facilities to enable, or 0.
disable_maskList of trace logging facilities to disable, or 0.

Masks are a bit field combination of the following logging facilities, or DB_TRACE_ALL to enable all logging facilities:

  • DB_TRACE_USERMSG
  • DB_TRACE_BUFMGR
  • DB_TRACE_LOCKMGR
  • DB_TRACE_LOGMGR
  • DB_TRACE_SPACEMGR
  • DB_TRACE_TXMGR
  • DB_TRACE_CATALOG
  • DB_TRACE_OSLIB
  • DB_TRACE_CAPI
  • DB_TRACE_DUMP
  • DB_TRACE_MEMTABLE
  • DB_TRACE_REP
  • DB_TRACE_BTREE
  • DB_TRACE_HEAP
  • DB_TRACE_DISKTABLE
  • DB_TRACE_SQL
  • DB_TRACE_IPC
  • DB_TRACE_JOURNAL
  • Copyright © 2005-2020 ITTIA™. All rights reserved.
